message: I was thinking this might be an alternative to the #indyrb IRC channel. What do you think?
Me too. But they're a YC company, so they don't have to for a while now.
Meh. Why not?
But, seems responsive enough
That would weigh into how I feel about it.
Sure.
Well-documented = simple. Not sure if the documentation is actually that good, but I'm not sure it needs to be.
And I saw someone working on an Android app too.
I wonder how they plan on monetizing it.
Meh. Maybe. What's the feature that makes it better than IRC?
You don't need to remember a bunch of cryptic commands, and you get automatic logging for free. Those are nice.
It's got an iPhone app as well.
And heard someone, definitely not me, was going to work on creating a native OSX version using MacRuby just to play with it.
Obviously downsides as well -- not an open protocol, less configurability, etc.
There's a well documented API as well, so it seems possible to bulk export everything if they go under.
yeah. I'm using the Android app right now. Seems useful. I'm for it.
good points jboyens, figured I'd throw it out there
I always have problems remembering to get on IRC and messing with my nick/pw and all that junk, I like this because it's pretty easy to use
oh I see, cofounder of convore
sry for the backhanded self promotion
Leah Culver will be speaking at re:build
I thought it was a post for a different topic, then remembered the earlier context
cool!
The cofounder (and lead dev) will be in town in July, You can ask her then about monetization strategies.
NICE.
Convore isn't local in the sense that someone made it here. Leah is from the midwest originally, but the company was made and is based in (you guessed it) The Bay Area
Ahh. I see Convore is a local product.
Damn that Bay Area! When are we going to have some great local products here?
